connectorUiConfig.title: Cyolo Sentinel Solution
connectorUiConfig.descriptionMarkdown: The [Cyolo Sentinel Solution](https://docs.cyolo.io/docs/how-to-create-api-keys) data connector allows ingesting logs from the Cyolo Scurity IDAC API into Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector is built on Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Platform. It uses the Cyolo Sentinel Solution API to fetch logs and it supports DCR-based [ingestion time transformations](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/custom-logs-overview) that parses the received security data into a custom table so that queries don't need to parse it again, thus resulting in better performance.

resourceProvider.permissionsDisplayText: Read and Write permissions are required.

parameters.content:
#### Configuration steps for the Cyolo Security Sentinel Solution API 
 Follow the instructions to obtain the credentials.

**1. Create API Token**
\ 1.1. Log in to the Cyolo Security IDAC Admin Console with Admin user credentials.
\ 1.2. In the Admin Console, click Identities -> API Keys.
\ 1.3. Under API Keys, click on New.
\ 1.4. Choose Name and click on Save.
\ 1.5. Copy the API Token.
\ [Cyolo Security REST API detailed Instructions](https://docs.cyolo.io/docs/how-to-create-api-keys)

**2. Grant Logs Permissions**
\ In the Admin Console, click Roles -> Admin.
\ 2.3. Under Log Admin, click on Edit.
\ 2.4. Choose the API Key from step 1 and click on Save.

\ [Learn more about Cyolo Security roles](https://docs.cyolo.io/docs/roles)

The Cyolo Sentinel Solution data connector allows ingesting logs from the Cyolo Security IDAC API into Microsoft Sentinel. The data connector is built on Microsoft Sentinel Codeless Connector Platform. It uses the Cyolo Sentinel Solution API to fetch agents, alerts, incidents, management and endpoint logs and it supports DCR-based ingestion time transformations that parses the received security data into a custom table, thus resulting in better performance.

Data Connectors: 1
